name: Matar Pulao
history: Matar Pulao, also known as Peas Pulao, is a popular dish in Indian cuisine. It's a simple yet flavorful rice dish made with green peas and aromatic spices. This dish is a staple in many Indian households and is often served as a part of a meal.
description: Matar Pulao is a light and fragrant rice dish that combines basmati rice with green peas, spices like cumin and bay leaves, and sometimes garnished with fresh herbs. It's a versatile dish that pairs well with various curries and Indian gravies.

instructions.title: Prepare Rice
instructions.description: Rinse the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak in water for 15 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: Cook Spices and Peas
instructions.description: In a pot, heat ghee and sautÃ© the cumin seeds and bay leaf. Add the green peas and sautÃ© for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Cook the Pulao
instructions.description: Add the drained rice to the pot. Pour in water and add salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish the pulao with chopped cilantro, if using. Serve hot as a side or main dish.

tips: Use high-quality basmati rice for the best flavor and texture.
Be careful not to overcook the peas to retain their vibrant color.
variations: Add a pinch of garam masala for an extra burst of flavor.
Include other vegetables like carrots or potatoes for a mixed vegetable pulao.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.

presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl with a side of raita or curry.
Garnish with additional herbs for a fresh look.
